plants.name: Rosa spp.
plants.description: Roses are iconic flowering shrubs known for their large, often fragrant blooms and thorny stems. They are widely cultivated worldwide and have thousands of varieties.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to early summer (May to June in temperate zones)
plants.location: Temperate regions globally, including North America, Europe, and Asia
plants.funFact: Roses have been cultivated for over 5,000 years and are symbols of love and beauty in many cultures.

plants.name: Lupinus perennis
plants.description: Wild lupine is a perennial wildflower with tall spikes of pea-like flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
plants.bloomingSeason: Spring to early summer (May to June)
plants.location: Eastern North America, especially in sandy soils and open woodlands
plants.funFact: Wild lupine is critical for the endangered Karner blue butterfly, which depends on it as a larval host plant.

plants.name: Tibouchina urvilleana
plants.description: A tropical evergreen shrub famous for its vibrant purple flowers with prominent stamens, often grown as ornamental plants in frost-free climates.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to early fall (May to October)
plants.location: Native to Brazil and cultivated in subtropical to tropical gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: The genus Tibouchina is named after a Guiana Amerindian name for one of the species.

plants.name: Erythronium japonicum
plants.description: A spring ephemeral wildflower with delicate nodding bell-shaped pink to lavender flowers and mottled leaves, blooming briefly in early spring to early summer.
plants.location: East Asia, including Japan, Korea, and parts of China
plants.funFact: The mottled leaves resemble a fawn's spots, hence the common name.
